channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Engineering Ambassadors Recruitment Open as of October 7
item.description: Date: Monday, October 7, 2024 12:00 AM - Tue , November 12, 2024 12:00 AM - Attention, all freshmen and sophomores! Applications are now open for the Engineering Ambassadors, a group that works with local schools to promote STEM exploration and make engineering more accessible to a younger audience. A recruitment information session will be held from 6PM to 7PM on November 12 in JEC 3232 to allow interested students to learn more about the organization and meet current Ambassadors.
item.author: Students

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.

item.title: Professional General Body Meeting with Goldman Sachs Slated for November 7
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 7, 2024 5:00 PM - 7:00 PM - Join the Society of Women Engineers, Women in Business, and the Association of Computing Machinery Women’s Chapter for this professional general body meeting with Goldman Sachs!
item.author: Students

item.title: H2M Architects, RPI Student “Meet and Greet” to be Held November 6
item.description: Join H2M at their Troy office right on River Street in downtown Troy with food, non-alcoholic drinks and refreshment and music!H2M is open to full-time seekers and interns in multiple areas, and this event is a casual opportunity for RPI students to come meet professionals across architecture, engineering, construction and environmental sciences from a local employer.

item.title: UPDATE: Bicentennial Student Club Showcase Cancelled
item.description: Date: Saturday, November 16, 2024 12:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Regrettably, the Student Club Showcase that was scheduled to be held as part of Rensselaer’s Bicentennial celebration has been cancelled.

item.title: Book Your COMM+D Appointment Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help! Just schedule an appointment with a member of our trained staff, then stop by the Comm+D offices on the lower level of Folsom Library.
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Open for 2024-2025 Barry Goldwater Scholarship
item.description: Established by Congress in 1986 to foster and encourage excellence in science and mathematics, the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation runs an educational scholarship program designed to provide opportunities for U.S. undergraduate students with strong academic records and outstanding research potential. The pre-application deadline is Monday, November 25, 2024; the final application deadline for nominated students is Monday, January 20, 2025.
item.author: Students

item.title: iEAR to Present Talk by Francois-Joseph Lapointe on November 6
item.description: As part of HASS’ Art, Science & Religion series, join iEAR from 5:00PM to 6:30PM on Wednesday, November 6 in the CBIS Auditorium for a talk by Francois-Joseph Lapointe, who will discuss how the transmission of the microbiome at birth plays a crucial role in shaping an individual’s health and development, representing a dynamic interplay between maternal and neonatal microbial communities.

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy Colloquium Series to Continue November 6
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - This colloquium will feature a presentation by Associate Professor Dr. Jianxi Gao, of Rensselaer’s Computer Science department.

item.title: MSE Seminars Continue November 6
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This seminar will feature a presentation titled “Exploring the Nanoworld: From Single-Molecule Chemistry to the Millimeter-Scale Engineering of Structures with Angstrom Precision,” by Udo D. Schwarz, of the Departments of Mechanical Engineering & Materials Science and Chemical & Environmental Engineering at Yale University.
item.author: Community

item.title: Virtual Event to Feature Discussion, Q&A with Speaker Dr. Nastaran Zahir
item.description: Date: Friday, November 8, 2024 8:30 AM - Join us for a virtual speaker and Q&A session with Dr. Nastaran Zahir, Director of the Cancer Training Branch in the Center for Cancer Training, National Cancer Institute, who will discuss NIH postdoctoral opportunities, funding for research, and career opportunities for scientists in government. Lunch will be provided at 11:00 AM, followed by the talk at noon.

item.title: Math Colloquium Slated for November 6
item.description: Date: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This Mathematical Sciences Colloquium will feature a presentation titled “A static quantum embedding scheme based on coupled cluster theory” by speaker Avijit Shee from University of California, Berkeley.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Meet and Greet” Lunch, Presentation to Feature Columbia University Professor Dr. Adam Brickman
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 7, 2024 12:00 PM - RSVP to attend this meet-and-greet lunch with Columbia University Professor of Neuropsychology, Dr. Adam Brickman, who, following lunch, will present a talk titled “Is there a role of cerebrovascular disease in our conceptualization of Alzheimer’s Disease?” at 3PM in the Bruggeman Room. Everyone is highly encouraged to attend both the lunch and presentation to make the most of this unique learning experience!
item.author: Community

item.title: “Time Regained” Musical Performance to Highlight Oliveros-Riley Partnership
item.description: Wednesday, November 6, 2024 at 4:00 pm – Showcasing the musical partnership of Pauline Oliveros and Terry Riley through the lens of time-delay techniques, this concert features the world premiere performance of Oliveros’s “The C(s) for Once (1966),” followed by Riley’s Keyboard Study #1 (1964), a piano solo that Oliveros dedicated to Riley, and other works. (Please note that this concert starts at 4:00 pm, and not at 7:00 pm as incorrectly noted in a previous announcement.)
item.author: Community

item.title: “Creating a Mail Merge with Word for Windows” to be Topic of Fac/Staff Quick Learn Session
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, November 12, 2024 10:30 AM - 11:00 AM - This session, which will focus on how to use data collected in Excel and combine it with a letter or label merge in Word, will also demonstrate how the Mail Merge Wizard can assist with the step-by-step process. If you often need to send out mass mailings, this workshop could be for you, so be sure to register!
